Review Title: superman returns; faithful to it's predecssors
Review: Being a huge superman fan for the most part of my life, i've read most of the comics and seen all the movies and TV. series. But you don't have to be a big superman fan to enjoy this movie. Superman Returns dosen't waste any time recaping the origin story we all already know. It basically picks up where superman II left off, but you'll have no problem following the storyline. My only complaints, are that it is a little too similar (both in style and storyline) to the older superman films. I did enjoy the shots were superman is in space, they were incredible (similar to some of the superman artwork of Alex Ross). I think it will be a very successful family film. 7/10

at first, i was unsure of watching this movie. I was never a big fan of superheros, and i didn't like any of the batman movies. But after i left the theaters watching Superman Returns, I was AMAZED. it was awesome. Now, it is definitely on my list of favorite movies. Even if you are not a fan of superhero movies or superman, you should absolutely watch it. It will definitely change your mind. It might start off slowly, but it becomes fast-paced and chock-full of suspense and action. It also includes romance and comedy. I give this movie a ten out of ten. If you haven't done so already, I STRONGLY suggest you get of your chair and go buy a ticket. Bring the family as well. They will love it

Review Title: Superman Returns with the best film in a long time
Review: From the strains of John Williams' music as we again here Jor-El and see Krypton explode to Williams' score playing as the credits roll and the dedication to Christopher and Dana Reeve, "Superman Returns" is easily the most inspirational and moving film in years.I found myself caring for and concerned about Superman from the beginning; I had to repeat to myself "it's a movie, just a movie" whenever Luthor put one of his heinous plots into motion.And whenever something catastrophic happened to Superman, I had to say to myself "There's going to be a sequel." To avoid from making a spectacle of myself.The way people talk about seeing Star Wars in the theater for the first time in 1977, with admiration and nostalgia--like it filled a void that they never knew existed--that's how I felt at the end of Superman Returns.Bryan Singer, I can say, got the formula right in a way that Richard Lester never did. For Richard Donner and now Bryan Singer, the movie is about the triangle of Clark (now Richard), Superman, and Lois. The action is only filler.

Garbage.The imagination required to make a good movie - never mind continuing an epic - was not used here. Don't believe the hype being pumped at you. You will be bored to tears, and so will the kids. Such a shame - I was really looking forward to this one.300 Million to make such a pile of dung, unbelievable... don't believe it! Ebert was totally right on this one and I'll bet Roeper tosses this donkey the very same heavy thumbs down this weekend.As a side note, Superman Returns sucked as bad as Hulk. If you liked Hulk, then go see this lemon! Hey - maybe they'll put out a box set: Hulk, Superman Returns, and X-Men: The Last Stand ! Call it... "The Box of Shame"I'm giving it 2 for John Ottman and John Williams' original score (the music, that is).( 2/10 )

I just saw this movie yesterday and I would like to say it is by far one of the most phenomenal movies of all time. The chosen actors play their roles beautifully. The story plot is fabulous and much more in depth than any of the other superhero action flicks. Quite honestly it blows the others out of the water. I personally was head over heels for Batman Begins when that movie came out last year, and I doubted that any type of action hero movie could top that one. However, I find myself changing opinions with the release of this Superman movie. After seeing this movie (although hard for me to say) I believe this is the MOVIE of THE SUMMER, if not the MOVIE of THE YEAR. I recommend all to go and see this. It is MUCH MORE than just an action movie. Take your dates, take your children, take your parents, take anyone to go see this because it will not disappoint. If it were possible to give this movie an 11 out of 10 it would, with out hesitation, receive it. ENJOY ALL!!!!.... Superman is back!!!

Superman gave me shivers..during the first hour or so ..then dithered with a sagging silly drawn out ending without a pulse. Shouldn't Superman end with a bang! That said, I would still rush to an IMAX 3-d screening because of some truly awesome action sequences..and an amazing title sequence. This is just as disappointing as Brian Singer's first XMEN film. He has made a fine film, but the story is pretty lousy..and we are forced into many scenes that are literally echos from the first film..that's boring (ooo there's another Superman flying with Lois Lane scene). Also boring is Lex Luther's scheme..(wont ruin, but it's just unengaged. After witnessing the Brilliance of Batman Begins, Superman just feels stupid, tired, and lazy. That's not to say that there wasn't a lot of hard work put into this baby, but if your going to get comic book silly, at least give us something for Superman to battle. Performances are fine..Spacey isn't nearly as good as Hackman.oh and the runaway car scene was atrocious (placed oddly, confusing for the sake of a later joke..)

Review Title: overall quite good / could have been super
Review: this superman movie is handled nicely. the acting is above average and the same could be said of its writing. overall direction by bryan singer? great. cinematography? perfect: the lighting, color tone, choices in perspective. a few goofy/cheese moments, but they come with the territory.how could it have been more super? the first half of the movie wonderfully establishes emotional conflicts between Superman and Lois. Without specifying these details, let's just say that they have some things to work out. These things--well, they really make the movie and our hero tick.So, the last half of the film carries much more tension related to action. and i love action. there is nothing better than well-staged suspense, but somehow the promise of conflict between lois and superman, between duty, truth, and family -- well, it's present, but passably.there is a wrap-up scene at the end that answers what i'm talking about but it is so brief and to me -- unsatisfying -- that you wonder how a two and a half-hour movie could not better complete its heart and soul.Constructive Criticism: it's silly offering this, because the piece is finished, but i will do this anyway like the workshops i've done to demonstrate that i am thinking positively about the film's deficiencies.the main problem is that superman doesn't make many choices about lois lane. he makes plenty about saving the world, which is good, because it's in his job description, but if he needs to grow, if one popular criticism of superman is that he's flawless, here's a chance where he can be more human. in love, people can act selfishly or be more self-centered. he does not. you see small moments of jealousy, yeah, but not any scenes entirely guided by it. in "smallville," clark is a bit more selfish and hormonally impulsive. he gets jealous and he does silly teenage things without thinking sometimes. superman doesn't have to do this; he's grown up now. i realize the admirable trait about superman is that he's quite selfless, but nobody's perfect and when we're in love, we question those imperfections. all i'm asking for is a better dramatic and cinematic expression of the tough love between lois and superman. it's great that she's nearly married and has a son; they got this part right. now this needs to played up more so he has to work harder.the bottom line: i enjoyed it. with the promise of depth in the beginning, i expected maturation by the end of a long movie. i know they're going to use it as groundwork for the sequel, but still, i hoped for more resonance.-- a fan of superheroes, liffeyride

Throughout the whole movie superman runs around with his tongue hanging out of his mouth for Lois Lane. He Saves the day for about 20 minuets of the movie. This movie ruined superman for another generation. I would not have even had my name associated with this movie, even as a costume designer. I do not think I will ever see a future superman movie. Since seeing this movie I am going to boycott anything superman from know on. This movie is the second on my list of worst movies I have ever seen. The only Film worse than superman returns was crocodile Dundee three. This movie does not deserve the genres of action. It is purely the definition of "Chick-Flick". Superman returns is not even worth watching on Television. As my conclusion, this movie was Awflu.

I was fortunate to see Superman Returns on Tuesday in an advanced screening at the IMAX theatre at Jordan's Furniture. Although only a few scenes were in actual IMAX 3-D, the overall effect was awe-inspiring. The film was an amazing experience and lived up to it's first two predecessors while avoiding all of the mistakes of Superman 3 and 4. The story picks up approximately 5 years after the Superman series left off. The only real problem with this is that presuming Superman 1-4 took place in the late 70's, five years later would put the time frame of this film in the 80's but the movie clearly take place in present day (made obvious by the technology present in the film, i.e. computers, cell phones, palm pilots). A mild error, but a forgivable one. Anyways, Superman returns home after a five year journey to the remains of Krypton. Once home he once again becomes Clark Kent and returns to work and soon thereafter reclaims his post as The Man of Steel. Brandon Routhe does a great job as Kent/Superman and Kevin Spacey gave a fabulous performance as the great Lex Luthor. The visuals are eye-popping, the acting and story are solid and this one is sure to be a hit. See it now!!!

I'm a big fan of superheroes in general, and grew up watching the cartoons. When it comes to the movies, I set my expectations high for this type of movie.I was thoroughly disappointed in X-Men 3 because the first two were so good. I loved the Spiderman movies and Batman Begins. After the X-Men 3 flop, and after reading some reviews on this Superman, I was a little scared about how it might turn out.Turns out I had nothing to worry about. This movie was awesome. It had great action and special effects, a solid story, a very convincing villain in Lex Luthor, and some comic relief to keep it from getting too serious. It did all this and in my opinion was still able to capture the classic Superman feel that we all saw in the original movies.Two thumbs up. I would buy this movie.

I was a little dubious about this release, what with all the hype. I was expecting to walk out of the movie after wards disappointed. How wrong was I?!! All I have to say is WOW. I really think this is one of the better movies that has come along in some time. I have been a Superman fan since seeing the original two way back when I was little, (lets just say 3 and 4 never existed) and thought that there would only ever be the one Superman - Christopher Reeve. Without dishonoring Christopher at all, this new Superman - Brandon Routh, does an amazing job. In some instances it's like watching Reeve all over again but then it goes back to Routh. I think Bryan Singer has done an amazing job with the character of Superman.I laughed, I cried and when it was over I walked out with a huge smile on my face!! I think most people will be happy with this interpretation, even if you are not a Superman fan -go and see it, it's a really top movie. I hope Superman fans everywhere enjoy it as much as I did.

Review Title: I Though They Yanked Tim Burton from this Film ... ???

Review: I have to say, I was looking forward to seeing the movie for while after i got hooked on toSmallville(Which is the best representation of Superman on TV or Film, and yes better than the original movie). I also have to say before i review this film, that I was not a big fan of the Richard Donner film. Yes it definitely had some classic moments, one of which is the speech from Jor-el to Kar-el, but it also had some really bad moments, like Lex Luther and his stupid way of stealing nuclear weapons(sorry gene hackmen, your Lex Luther sucked).Based on those comments, Superman Retuns is good,but not great.This movie had so much potential, but it seemed they were too afraid to out due Richard Donner's persumed Classic,Superman The movie. I was fine with Superman leaving Earth for 5 years, but when he came back, a lot of things should of changed since his passing, but the only thing that moved on was Lois Lane having a kid with another guy. It would of been nice to see how the world has moved on as well. If they stress that a little more and Kar-el trying to find place in the world, you would of cared more him like he was a orphan.As for the Casting of Superman, Brandon Routh does a pretty good job as Superman, but his Clark kent is little off. Clack Kent in the Original movie was one of the best parts of the movie because it was so funny to see the Man of steel being a bumbling idiot. As for Kate Bosworth, She actually did a better job than I expected. I thought initially she was too young for the role, but she actually hold her own in the movie. The only problem was that she lacks the spunkiness of Maggort Kidder. I have to mention this, but I was very disappointed to see what they did with Kal Penn's Character. He didn't even have a line in the movie, he seemed more like a extra than actual character. What a waste of good talent. The person who stole the show was Kevin Spacey. He actually makes Lex Luther sadistic, unlike Gene Hackmen, who portrayed Lex Luther like some cartoon character. As for directing and story, this I say is what hinders the movie from being a classic on its own. Bryan Singer spends way to much time paying homage to the original film instead of making it his own. I must say Bryan Singer storytelling ability is becoming weaker by the day. He needs to do a low-budget drama before doing the next superman movie, because in a lot ways it seemed like Michael Bay was directing this movie. As for the story, it spends way too much time on how Lex Luther scheming his way to make his own country(literally) than dwelling into the character of Superman, seeing how he is trying to find his purpose on his adoptive home.Also if your expecting breath taking Action Sequences don't hold your breath, their are not so many, and when you do see them, it seems like you have seen better(Spider-man 2 ring a bell). I think Bryan Singer and his writers should use Batman Begins as a point of reference instead of the Original Superman Movie.

this movie made me cry. it was so awful i almost sharted. i think superman in this movie was a bit gay. i know he kisses Lois lane, but i think he really is thinking about Lex Luthor. i absolutely hated this movie and will not support it no matter what. GO SPIDERMAN. Spiderman movies are way more intriguing and than retarded superman movies. These movies make my stomach go bad. SUPERMAN can go f*** Lex Luthor. SPIDERMAN 3 is gonna be the best movie in the world. If i had Kryptonite i would stab superman with it a million times. after he is dead i would shoot him in the chest. i would also tell him go get a t-shirt that says "If you shoot me in the chest, I bleed".

"Superman Returns" is a terrific movie.It has great action and the CGI is amazing. It kept me wanting more at the end.I've heard people say " It's too long and they weren't true to the other Superman movies" and " It didn't pass Star Wars for highest opening on a Wed, so it's a flop".First off , it doesn't have to beat "Star Wars" to be a hit. Second, the speed of the film was just right for me. There was a lot to be said and explained, so you can't really be upset over that. As for staying true to the pass Superman movies, it certainly was. Brandon Routh did a terrific job adding his own twist on the Man of Steel , while keeping a little of Christopher Reeves personality in it as well. I think"Superman Returns" is one of the greatest superhero movies in film history. I find it an equal match to the first two Superman movies.

Look. If you're a die hard Superman fan from birth. One who has followed him for years through every trial and tribulation. (And yes, I even mean the crappy electric blue Superman in the comics.) Then guess what? You probably won't dig this movie. BUT, if you look at it from the point of view that these are characters from a MOVIE (NOT a comic book), than you will love this movie. From the moment the credits roll, you will be transported back to the Christopher Reeve flicks of old. In my honest opinion, it does a very good job keeping the tone of the movies alive. There are subtle hints and dialog back to the events of some of those movies in fact. Routh was very good. Not PERFECT, but this is his first flight in the tights. Spacey I thought was perfect casting, and the same went for Bosworth. I've read numerous complaints about her in the movie, and they seem to all be unfounded.The film is beautiful. You could tell Singer had the love for this movie. Don't worry, I haven't forgot the special effects. The F/X in this movie are some of the best I have seen in years. They really do justice to the legacy of Superman.Please don't let a few negative reviews sway you. Go see this movie.

i saw superman returns last night on its opening day and was blown away. the old superman movies are classics but this movie is an awesome movie in its own right. the story was really interesting and easy to follow and was a good job considering all the past of superman story lines. the special effects were the best you would ever see at this point in time and it was mainly really cool to see superman fly 'for real' for the first time instead of the old dated graphics from the original movies. the cinema i was in cheered at the end of the movie which is pretty damn rare. for people who may judge it harshly and be embarrassed to go watch it just give it a chance, its worth the money.

Review Title: Better than I thought it would be
Review: Here is the short review. I hated the first fifteen minutes. The opening credits go on forever and the music sounds straight out of star wars. Then the dialog and film cuts are too choppy to get anything going.This changes completely with the first major rescue scene. At that moment the movie changes into a very exciting movie that only drags a little in places.I went with my wife and kids and we all enjoyed it. The special effects go up to the level where the CGI is not very obvious. There is also a love story angle like in the first Spiderman. While Lex Luthor talks some bad stuff there is very little violence.In my opinion, men, women and children will all go for this movie and it will be a giant hit.My only peeve is that the movie is to PC and omits the words "...and the American Way." It is quite obvious that this film reflects America. Regardless of politics, The American Way is almost universally admired in most countries.

Honestly, while the original movies will always maintain classic status and a lofty place in my heart, Superman Returns is the definitive Superman movie for me now, and after multiple viewings it only continues to increase its hold over my imagination. I was utterly speechless after seeing it at the first 10:00 IMAX 3D showing on Tuesday night with a sold out theater, as were my friends who were with me. We couldn't contain our amazement and excitement. Spin-tingling moments abounded. I laughed and cheered, and felt my emotions rise as Superman took to the sky. Honestly, there isn't much I can say about this film that you won't read somewhere else, and if you have seen the movie you really don't need to read reviews. If you haven't seen this movie, you owe it to yourself to check it out. Movies like this don't get made very often. This is the kind of movie you tell your children about seeing in the theater when you were young, the kind of movie people look back on years from now as a hallmark of the great days of epic movie-making. Be a part of this event, you won't be disappointed.

Review Title: Teases A Payoff Which It Doesn't Deliver...

Review: This movie lived up to every one of my expectations. As an avid Superman fan for years, I couldn't wait for this movie to come out. And it was excellent. Easily the best movie of the year. Brandon Routh does a superb job as Superman/Clark Kent. Not as good as Chritopher Reeve, because I don't think anyone could ever be that good, but he's awesome, still. I was totally sucked in to the story. The casting is absolutely perfect. Kevin Spacey plays an excellent Lex Luthor. When the credits rolled, I looked at my watch, and two and a half hours had gone by. But it is worth every minute of it. I can't say enough about this movie. This is the best "super hero" movie released recently. Surpassing X-Men, Spiderman, and Batman. They can't make the sequels fast enough.

I was one of those who was wishing this movie was an absolute stinker. Actually, the movie is good. Not very good, not great, but good nonetheless. Brandon Routh really shines in this movie. Not because he is Superman, but because he truly took the opportunity that was given to him and did his absolute best. The boy can act pretty well, and although he may not be the greatest actor in the world, he did the job and, in my opinion, did it well. Kevin Spacey does the best that Kevin Spacey can do, so he didn't particularly dazzle me, nor the other actors/actresses. The special effects are not spectacular, but are still very good. The way they portrayed Superman flying was excellent. The truly visualized the way it should be, I think. The movie overall concentrates on a heartfelt, sentimental storyline, however, it stumbles here and there when dealing with certain issues that are presented in such an artificial manner that really didn't convince me. Although, I must agree with someone who wrote that seeing how humble and giving Superman is portrayed in this movie brings a tear to the eye and wishes there was somebody that good in real life (and had the great super powers, as well). Although, sometimes I felt they were portraying him as if he were Jesus Christ(Don't worry Christians, it's not as blasphemous as it sounds.) Worth seeing, but don't expect to see the best Superman movie ever.

Look. If you're a die hard Superman fan from birth. One who has followed him for years through every trial and tribulation. (And yes, I even mean the crappy electric blue Superman in the comics.) Then guess what? You probably won't dig this movie. BUT, if you look at it from the point of view that these are characters from a MOVIE (NOT a comic book), than you will love this movie. From the moment the credits roll, you will be transported back to the Christopher Reeve flicks of old. In my honest opinion, it does a very good job keeping the tone of the movies alive. There are subtle hints and dialog back to the events of some of those movies in fact. Routh was very good. Not PERFECT, but this is his first flight in the tights. Spacey I thought was perfect casting, and the same went for Bosworth. I've read numerous complaints about her in the movie, and they seem to all be unfounded.The film is beautiful. You could tell Singer had the love for this movie. Don't worry, I haven't forgot the special effects. The F/X in this movie are some of the best I have seen in years. They really do justice to the legacy of Superman.Please don't let a few negative reviews sway you. Go see this movie.

i saw superman returns last night on its opening day and was blown away. the old superman movies are classics but this movie is an awesome movie in its own right. the story was really interesting and easy to follow and was a good job considering all the past of superman story lines. the special effects were the best you would ever see at this point in time and it was mainly really cool to see superman fly 'for real' for the first time instead of the old dated graphics from the original movies. the cinema i was in cheered at the end of the movie which is pretty damn rare. for people who may judge it harshly and be embarrassed to go watch it just give it a chance, its worth the money.

Review Title: Better than I thought it would be
Review: Here is the short review. I hated the first fifteen minutes. The opening credits go on forever and the music sounds straight out of star wars. Then the dialog and film cuts are too choppy to get anything going.This changes completely with the first major rescue scene. At that moment the movie changes into a very exciting movie that only drags a little in places.I went with my wife and kids and we all enjoyed it. The special effects go up to the level where the CGI is not very obvious. There is also a love story angle like in the first Spiderman. While Lex Luthor talks some bad stuff there is very little violence.In my opinion, men, women and children will all go for this movie and it will be a giant hit.My only peeve is that the movie is to PC and omits the words "...and the American Way." It is quite obvious that this film reflects America. Regardless of politics, The American Way is almost universally admired in most countries.

Honestly, while the original movies will always maintain classic status and a lofty place in my heart, Superman Returns is the definitive Superman movie for me now, and after multiple viewings it only continues to increase its hold over my imagination. I was utterly speechless after seeing it at the first 10:00 IMAX 3D showing on Tuesday night with a sold out theater, as were my friends who were with me. We couldn't contain our amazement and excitement. Spin-tingling moments abounded. I laughed and cheered, and felt my emotions rise as Superman took to the sky. Honestly, there isn't much I can say about this film that you won't read somewhere else, and if you have seen the movie you really don't need to read reviews. If you haven't seen this movie, you owe it to yourself to check it out. Movies like this don't get made very often. This is the kind of movie you tell your children about seeing in the theater when you were young, the kind of movie people look back on years from now as a hallmark of the great days of epic movie-making. Be a part of this event, you won't be disappointed.

Review Title: Teases A Payoff Which It Doesn't Deliver...

Review: This movie lived up to every one of my expectations. As an avid Superman fan for years, I couldn't wait for this movie to come out. And it was excellent. Easily the best movie of the year. Brandon Routh does a superb job as Superman/Clark Kent. Not as good as Chritopher Reeve, because I don't think anyone could ever be that good, but he's awesome, still. I was totally sucked in to the story. The casting is absolutely perfect. Kevin Spacey plays an excellent Lex Luthor. When the credits rolled, I looked at my watch, and two and a half hours had gone by. But it is worth every minute of it. I can't say enough about this movie. This is the best "super hero" movie released recently. Surpassing X-Men, Spiderman, and Batman. They can't make the sequels fast enough.

I was one of those who was wishing this movie was an absolute stinker. Actually, the movie is good. Not very good, not great, but good nonetheless. Brandon Routh really shines in this movie. Not because he is Superman, but because he truly took the opportunity that was given to him and did his absolute best. The boy can act pretty well, and although he may not be the greatest actor in the world, he did the job and, in my opinion, did it well. Kevin Spacey does the best that Kevin Spacey can do, so he didn't particularly dazzle me, nor the other actors/actresses. The special effects are not spectacular, but are still very good. The way they portrayed Superman flying was excellent. The truly visualized the way it should be, I think. The movie overall concentrates on a heartfelt, sentimental storyline, however, it stumbles here and there when dealing with certain issues that are presented in such an artificial manner that really didn't convince me. Although, I must agree with someone who wrote that seeing how humble and giving Superman is portrayed in this movie brings a tear to the eye and wishes there was somebody that good in real life (and had the great super powers, as well). Although, sometimes I felt they were portraying him as if he were Jesus Christ(Don't worry Christians, it's not as blasphemous as it sounds.) Worth seeing, but don't expect to see the best Superman movie ever.

Review Title: Too Busy To Make A Great Film
Review: Bryan Singer like many directors was trying to do too much with this movie while still doing other endeavors as well. Like King Kong, Superman Returns suffers from not enough attention to the big picture and too much attention to every little detail. Though this may seem like an odd observation it is true that if a movie has so much frame by frame because the director was putting too much intellect on little things he forgets that 2 hours and thirty minutes can become quite uncomfortable. Take a look at Family Guy. Great show. But it was much better when Seth McFarlane had all his time to devote to it rather than having American Dad to worry about as well. Bottom Line, Singer should have left his super schedule to superheroes and made the movie we all know he should have made!

Review Title: The Difference between Superman and other super heroes...
Review: Superman has always been a patriotic symbol. Truth, Justice, the American way, and all of that lovely stuff. For a long time I have never been impressed with Superman to much, because, well, he was to perfect and the tights were dorky. Sure Spider-Man wears tights, but its somewhat for a reason (needing flexibility to move and to cover his identity), and the suit for spidey is also actually kinda cool because of its design. Other super heroes Usually wear armor or some kinda of leather vests (Batman, X-Men). This Superman movie once again proves that the Man of Steel is also the the Dork of Steel. But costumes aside, lets get to why I really dislike this movie... Brandon Routh, wooden acting. It made me think that maybe the suit was to tight in certain places with as lame and stolid his lines were. When he was acting well, he seemed sad-sack and depressed. Kate Bosworth. Not just not a Lois Lane type. What great movies made her fit for this role anyway? Same goes for Brandon Routh on that subject. The kid: Another clichéd annoying little kid character twit who stands around looking at people giving them the stink eye and saying things like "Superman will save us, you're mean Lex Luthor!" (He didn't actually say that, its just an example of the way he acted.. Talk about someone who deserves to be b****slapped. Kevin Spacey- while having a few moments with the Luthor character that entertained me, I wasn't to impressed. (He had a much better villain character in another of Bryan Singer's movies that was actually good (The Usual Suspects). While I usually like Singer's movies (X-Men and X2 were incredible I thought, same as The Usual Suspects) I am afraid the bullet this movie will take at the box office will be one that won't be bouncing off of Superman's chest. Sure it may make 200 million, but does a guy with those kinds of tights, and the reviews of such mediocre acting really going to appeal with middle America movie goers? Especially with rumors going about that Superman's sexuality in the movie is questionable (I didn't think he was gay like the rumors said, but still). Come on, despite the whole push for so-called tolerance and diversity for gay people, the fact is most of family movie going Americans will avoid movies that may subject their children to that ideal (even though the rumors I personally found untrue). Its not a crime to try and avoid it, its just traditionalism. Along with Superman being a crappy movie, plus the whole tights thing and the rumors, I expect this movie to barely break even despite the 20 million start. But maybe I'll be wrong. My prediction though, either way, is that Pirates will "ransack, pillage, and plunder" all of Superman's movie goers to the different side of the cinema. Pirates 2 not only had a great first movie/prequel, but was a surprise hit (It would've been even bigger there was more advertising and critics actually realizing what a good movie is). My expectations: Superman finishes at most 270 million Pirates - A lot more.

Review Title: A two and a half hour introduction to the sequel.
Review: Most people loved the old Superman movies. I'm one of them. But why, after I've seen 4 of them already, Brian Singer thinks I'd want to see a 5th, is beyond me.Superman Returns is just what the title implies. A return to cheesy plots and one-dimensional characters; which may be charming in a decades old flick, but certainly isn't the case in a modern film. I'm sorry, but dressing everyone in clothes from the fifties and making them say 'swell' does not make me feel warm and fuzzy inside.All things considered, it isn't a terrible movie. The acting is passable (all criticism for the acting should, I believe, go to the director, because it is his vision of a corny archetype that they all portray), the special effects are entertaining, but unfortunately the script plays like a first draft.It isn't until the movie is practically over that one realises, 'hey! nothing happened in this movie.' There is no development, no climax, and no resolution. It is a 2 and a half hour introduction to the sequel.And, as a final rant, fans of the 'real' Superman of the comic world will be the most disappointed of all. Give this one a wide berth if you're a true Superman fan, because Singer wants to add to the Superman Mythos when he has neither the talent nor the credentials to do so. Please, movie makers, leave the development of comic characters to the people who have been writing them for years. We don't want your input.

Review Title: Excellent! A masterpiece of epic film-making!
Review: I had extremely high expectations for this movie. Richard Donner's Superman is one of my favorite movies and I feel one of the best movies ever made. Bold statement. I stand by it 100%. I was beyond disappointed by Superman 3 and Quest for Peace, so I've been waiting for a long time for a REAL Superman movie and at the 10:00 show on Tuesday night I got A REAL SUPERMAN MOVIE. Superman Returns is a beautifully shot, superbly designed, smartly written, wonderfully performed and masterfully directed masterpiece of epic film-making. This movie gets it right on all levels for me. It treats Superman with the reverence and respect the character deserves, it got the romance between Lois and Superman, the nerdiness of Clark, the evil and fun of Lex Luthor- everything is spot on. This review is basically a love letter and I don't care. I loved SUPERMAN RETURNS. Congratulations to Bryan Singer and his team; you did it. Thank you.

I just got back from the movie and it was awesome. This is coming from a guy who is very *picky* with movies. I am not easily impressed.I thought the acting and story were good, they tied up all the loose ends and kept it very entertaining. It was no Braveheart, but very entertaining for a summer movie. I really tried to keep my expectations low, as good press can really ruin a movie for me as I am expecting so much. Kevin Spacey made a great Lex Luther, and Brandon Routh was well suited for Superman, IMHO..I think Bryan Singer did a great job, as I like most of his movies, and gave the fans what they wanted. It is a creepy how much Brandon Routh resembles Christopher Reeve in Clark Kent mode..

Review Title: It's Not Your Father's Superman; it's a new level of storytelling for the old epic.

Review: This was a good film, but not great. Why? Well, it fails to surprise (cept this one part around the end of the film. I won't tell.) It's predictable in every way. Superman flies around, he saves people, he stops buildings from collapsing. There were second to no action scenes which really made the film a bit boring. Storyline wise, it wasn't bad but there is only so much you can do with Superman.Highlight of the film was Lex Luthor. He's witty, charming, and just plain evil.Overall, it was an alright movie but no second viewing or DVD purchases for me.

Review Title: Is this a Remake or a Sequel
Review: I just got out of a matinée of Superman Returns. And I'm confused, or rather the film was, it didn't seem to know if it was a remake or sequel. I heard that this was essentially the next movie after Superman II, but I'd rather watch the one with Richard Prior again than sit through the 2 and a half extremely slow hours.The only high point being Kevin Spacy as Lex Luthor, in fact, at times, I could have sworn it was Gene Hackman up there. Not that I have anything against seeing Kevin Spacy, but he seemed to be the only returning character that realized there was already a character built, and to be built on.All in all it was as disappointing as the movie Brian Singer should have come out with this year, X Men: The Last Stand.

No one can replace Christopher Reeve-no one. This is the worst movie I've ever seen in my life, it was so bad I walked out after about fifteen minutes. This movie sucked big time. Talk about a bad sequel. Christopher was the one and only Superman there could ever be, and the new actor sucked. I really wasted my money on this garbage. Even the new Lex Luthor was bad, Kevin Spacey? C'mon. You can do better than that. If there is a 6 I'm NOT going to see it. What a horrible movie. Superman, you super suck! Christopher Reeve was the one and only. He was a good actor and the best Superman ever. Too bad for his death. No one can replace him. He made his name as the best Superman.

The Legacy of Superman has officially been carried on. Superman Returns was a thrill ride from start to finish. Killer Story, Characters, action and FX. The cast does an outstanding job of bringing the 'classic' superman way of life back to it's roots. Brandon Ruth, hits the quarky subtleties of Clark Kent on the head every chance he gets and shifts to Superman naturally and powerfully. What a performance. Singer new what he had to do with this, and although he had to leave us on Xmen, it most certainly shows he put everything he had into Superman Returns. Kate Bosworth delivers an outstanding performance as Lois Lane. Lois' character plays heavily off of the main plot and Bosworth and Ruth manage to create a love story for the Ages. And of course, Kevin Spacey as Lex Luther deserves applause at the end of every scene.....All in all, no complaints, feel lucky as hell to see it in the theatres - CHECK THIS MOVIE OUT, you will not be disappointed!

Review Title: Better than expected, but still disappointing...
Review: I once was a huge fan of the Superman comics. Having said that, I was eagerly awaiting this movie.Thankfully this movie was a good 2 and a half hours of Superman goodness. Once again we get to see the man in tights do his usual stuff and the action scenes are fantastic, one in particular which I will not mention was amazing. The re-creation of Smallville was absolutely brilliant and flawless. Although, Martha got almost no screen time and his father was apparently dead? What the...? His parents in the comics play a huge part and are a joy which sadly lacked in this film. Sigh...The acting was fantastic despite me believing it to be poorly casted judging by the trailers. Kevin Spacey in particular was a standout as always. Perhaps though, I do think that Rachel McAdams would have been the ideal Lois Lane. Speaking of Lois Lane, she was one of my main annoyances with this film. They should have called it 'Lois Lane' instead of Superman because she seemed to get a lot more screen time than he did! When he was on screen though, it was fantastic. The sequences were amazing but sadly few and far between. Sure we needed a good story, but having a new Superman film made with todays special effects, we wanted to see what Brian Singer could do with the endless amount of possibilities for action sequences. This failed to deliver. Big time. The story was to a fan such as myself, extremely random. I didn't want to see this whole Lois with a kid plot which I didn't think worked at all due to both the leads having no chemistry with each other. Comparing this to Spiderman 2 for example, the chemistry was so good that they produced one of the best kissing sequences ever put on film whilst maintaining a huge adrenaline ride. In comparison, Superman was rather boring. Furthermore, unlike X-Men or Batman Begins, the evil scheme given to Lex Luthor to take over the world was rather weak especially considering how many good plots they could have pulled out of the comics.The best part of this film would have to be Brandon Routh's portrayal of Clark Kent which he pulls off extremely well. All the geekiness of Clark Kent shines and we see the character we have all known to love...In a nutshell, for a film that cost so much to make, it sure didn't seem like it cost that much. Where was all the action? We want to see Superman pull off amazing feats and save the planet, not cry with Lois.

I viewed this film with much in trepidation after III and IV were so lame, and the hype around this film has been huge! I didn't think it could live up to everything it was supposed to be, but I was wrong...From the opening credits - which established a direct link to the previous films - to the twists and turns of the plot, this movie was more than I expected at every turn. My two teen-aged daughters - who never saw any superman film before - were entranced by the guy in the long underwear from the first to the last.Overall, there were some unexpected twists and turns to turn comic fan-boy-loyalists sick, but as a continuation from the first two films over two decades ago, this movie lives up to all my expectations.Of the things I liked a great deal follow here, as well as some *SPOILERS* so don't read on unless you can deal with not being surprised at the movie.1. The opening credits were an good homage to the original film. 2. The saving of the 777 and Shuttle sequence left the previous films in the dust with what they can do today, but Superman's line about air-travel being safe made me laugh so hard my daughters were confused about what I found so funny. Having never seen the first two films, they didn't realize how close to the original the line was in delivery and context. 3. Kevin Spacy as Luthor did a great job. Not only did he manage to pick up on Gene Hackman's sociopathic quirks, but he also managed to infuse quite a bit of his own queasy charisma into the role that wasn't there before. 4. The bit about Lane's kid, "Who is his father." pretty much got answered here, but at the end of the film I was genuinely impressed over how the movie treated the subject. The piano bit was just enough at just the right time, and the choice to leave it at that left me happy enough. They could have easily put the kid in jammmies and a cape as well, but resisted the urge to do so. They even flirted with the whole super-powers thing to keep me chuckling throughout the movie. 5. Jimmy Olson has never been played on screen better. I always ignored JO's roles as crap, because they were, but here the actor managed to make an impression. Weather that was the script, director, actor, or all three I don't know, but it worked and for the first time I actually liked Jimmy. 6. The overall plot was typically movie-superman over comic-superman, but it worked well. I felt like this was the third installment that should have been out twenty years ago. As much as I love Richard Pryor, I'd now vote to burn all Superman III prints now. 7. The only two things that bothered me about the film were simple little things that don't hurt it much, but kept this from being a 10. A. The length of the film is overly long and parts of it could do with a little trimming. 10 minutes short of 3 hours is a bit much, even for Superman. B. The bit about the bullet to the eyeball was nice to see, but didn't really fit much, and the lack of Clark Kent hurt the story by it's not being there.I am now looking forward to the next movie (which there which is inescapable now) and my Daughters and I are off to go rent the first two films to catch them up on all that came before.

Review Title: Dosn't have the fun of Richerd Donner, or the Style of Chris Nolan
Review: i've been hearing a lot about how this film is for Superman what Batman Begins was for Batman. let me say alligoricly that this is not true in the least. Odly enough Singer probably would have had a better film if he stuck with the X-men Franchise.the film lacks the fun or the wit of the Donner/Reeve films. in which Superman and Lois Lane had real chemistry and motivation. in this film they seemed to me to be rather bored. more concerned with looking good and being "Solem and Brooding" then actually living up the roles.as for it's inevitable comparisons with the fantastic Batman Begins. well Batman has always been a dark brooding figure. and that film gave it's characters depth and range. this film has it's characters spouting terrible lines and doing what the plot requires of them.as for Spacey. he lacks the Charisma and frustrated humor that Hackmen so held in his over the top performance of lex Luther. Spacey seems more vindictave and Hatefull, then smart and "Dasterdly". the film tries to be to dark in places it shouldn't, and creates humor in situations were it isn't requires.while Batman is a Dark, brooding, wounded figure, superman is supposed to represent all that is good and pure. two things this film is not.

I've been excited about seeing Superman Returns for months and it was very worthy of all the excitement. I saw it last night and from the minute it began I was captivated. Brandon Routh is amazing in his role as Superman/Clark Kent. It was like he didn't even have to try. He simply WAS Superman. Kate Bosworth was great as Lois Lane, too. Kevin Spacey was an excellent Lex Luthor. Frank Langella, James Marsden, Parker Posey, and Sam Huntington had great supporting roles here, too. One thing I was very happy about was the fact that there were no fake-looking special effects and a bunch of obviously computer-generated shots of Superman flying. I think Superman fans are going to love this movie as much as I did. People ought to get used to Brandon Routh's face because, after this performance, I'm sure we'll be seeing him around.

Brandon Routh totally fails to fill up the Superman image. He doesn't have the physical build nor the personality to impress anyone. I'd even say he fails as Clark Kent. George Reeves as well as Christopher Reeves aren't in any danger of being overshadowed by Brandon. It's downright embarrassing to watch his attempts to portray the man of steel. Child of tin, maybe. The Lois Lane casting was also abominable, with no chemistry between her and the S man. The whole story just lays there, and is most improbable, even for fantasy. It was pretty ugly watching this child director's attempts to deliver something worth watching. What a waste of an awful lot of money. Can't anyone write a decent story or find actors that can impress the audience?

Review Title: Too slow and weak, like Supes around green kryptonite.

Review: the film has an excellent story..i haven't seen any of the Christopher Reeve versions for a good part of 15 years, however this movie with Brandon Routh doing a superb job as the man of steel, was great on it's own. The performances of Kevin Spacey, Kate Bosworth, and the always enchanting Parker Posey deliver exceptional performances. I'm especially excited to see where the epic tale ventures next. The Only drawback that I would comment on, is that the movie runs two and a half hours...which is personally no problem to me, however it is such an interesting story that if you have problems sitting in a theatre for long periods of time, or have children..go to the bath room before it starts and get someone to watch your kids..if you can't...then wait for the DVD.

Come on guys, there are things we all strive for in superhero movies these days, like character development, an original story and exhilarating action sequences.This film only delivers part of one of these, and that's the action sequences. The story has got to be the worst part, and with such strong references to the events of the first movie, you'd think they watched the first one and re-wrote it.Why superman comes back with a massive asteroid, or whatever it is, practically half dead is beyond me. Why Lois doesn't greet her old friend Clark after a 5 year absence with a little more enthusiasm or just plane shock that he's there, is also confusing. She practically ignores him throughout the movie and then vents her angry feelings for superman while he's trying to set a time to catch up. Anyone else think the similarities to the original are a little too strong in the movie?1.Lois's first interaction with superman in both movies is after he saves her from a horrific aeronautical accident. The Boeing crash is basically the helicopter crash on a 200 million dollar budget.2.Superman tries to win Lois over in both movies by taking her for a night flight over the city, the balcony scene is practically the same. Only difference? Oh now she's mad at him.3.Lex Luthor's female sidekick in both movies not only betrays Lex, but has a secret crush on superman. It's basically the same character.4.Superman almost dies once again by being heavily confronted with Kryptonite and thrown into water. If superman can breath in space, why is being underwater even a problem?This entire movie feels like the re-written Donner version. Very clever by the way adding the line where Lois inquires how to spell a word for her article, similar to the original. But keep in mind that now she's the only Pulitzer Prize winner in Metropolis who doesn't use spell check.Can anyone explain to me why a group of criminals would rob a bank with a mini gun mounted on the roof? Someone tell me why Metropolis' finest continue to shoot the operator of a mini gun in JUST the bullet-proof vest, and then give him plenty of time to turn around?When the tiniest piece of the crystal is thrown into the water amidst the model town, no tiny land mass rises. Nor is there any evidence that the crystal has that kind of effect in water. Just the crack in the ground and a massive power outage. How in the world does Lex even begin to conclude that throwing an entire crystal into the ocean will raise up any land at all? Or the amount of land to the exact specifications of his ridiculous "overlapping maps" contraption in his office. It's pretty convenient that he has that map thing just in case he were to explain to anyone (in sequence) what would apparently happen if he were to launch a crystal into the ocean.The entire land mass (which isn't even habitable) superman lifts up is loaded with Kryptonite, at that amount it would be impossible for superman to lift that kind of weight, or himself for that matter. Kryptonite doesn't "burn" superman, it's makes him weaker. We all know this.How about Perry White just standing there like a fool as he watches the Daily Planet ball fall directly on him. Thanks Jimmy for even making an effort to save your boss, let alone get out of the way.Speaking of Jimmy, anyone else think it's ironic that after 5 years of working for a professional newspaper he acts as though he's completely clueless about everything?How about the ending that just drags on, and on, and on. I felt like I was watching the last minutes of Return of the King all over again.Oh and how in any universe does the son of superman have asthma? Or allergies to almost every type of food and requires multiple vitamins every day?I'm not trying to be one of those jerks who slams everyone who liked this movie, like it if you want. But my question is, why?

After having recently viewed "Batman Begins," I expected a great comic book movie from "Superman Returns." Instead, I witnessed a formulaic film with a generic script (the tag line?-- "I'm always around"). This aggravates me because of the film's big budget and hype. To be frank, I feel let down after viewing "Superman Returns." With a running time of 2 hours and 20 minutes, "Superman Returns" drags (mainly because of the generic dialogue in the script). The action sequences lack ingenuity (Superman lifts a lot of heavy objects and keeps them from falling on people) and the dialogue is forced (see the tag line of the film). That being said, there are, at least, a few bright spots with the film: Bryan Singer's direction is superb, Kevin Spacey relishes in his role as the villain, and Brandon Routh fits the bill (at least he looks like Superman...). Still, I feel a bit disappointed... I try not to go to the theaters (and use a large portion of my money) in exchange for a viewing of a decent film... especially when I expected more.

This is a great movie. Although certainly an homage to the Christopher Reeve era, this edition is superior. Whereas a lot of the Reeve/Hackman Superman/Lex Luthor movie was campy and tongue in cheek (and well done nonetheless), "Superman Returns" is more serious, and benefits from it. Brandon Routh plays a flawless Clark/Superman, Lois is great, and so is James Marsden as Lois' significant other "superman." Some reviewers did not see much of a plot, but Singer & Co. do a great job of continuing Luthor's obsession without making a joke of it. We get to see and hear some of the original inspiration for the movie, including Marlon Brando. Look for Virgin Atlantic's Richard Branson in a cameo role as a Shuttle pilot. See it!

After viewing the movie for the first time, I would watch this movie again and again. Fans who have seen this movie will gladly accept this movie as the real continuation to Superman: The Movie (1978) and Superman II (1980), from the awesome opening credits. MY GOD I LOVED THE OPENING CREDITS!!! to the sweet ending of what would open for a sequel hopefully. Bryan Singer was all perfect for Superman Returns, and does truly bring a comic book to life, just as he did for the X-Men movies. His experience of directing comic book movies, is what really made this movie come to life, as well as handling a good plot to what looks like is from the comics.Brandon Routh was very true to portraying Superman/Clark Kent...Even though, his face is somewhere to look like Chris, his character from Clark is just like the comics and movies combined. Brandon truly did take Clark Kent/Superman to a new level as facing challenges, as well making Superman as a symbol of hope.Kate Bosworth as Lois Lane. Kate's character in the movie really did impress me a lot. Her character as Lois Lane was a major departure from the comics, although I give credit for her performance to be as realistic as possible, and plus I sort of do like the idea that her character Lois Lane has a new love life and tries to move on, but she does show some feelings she has for Superman.The themes to the Superman movies are as followed: -Superman: The Movie -Power and Responsibility. -Superman II -The Choice to have Power or give it up. -Superman Returns -Emotion, Maturity, and Redemption.Even though there are fans who complain that this movie is stupid, of whom I do agree that there were some flaws of which I couldn't understand as well and a bit some confusion to what the plot was really talking about, Superman Returns is about maturity, and truly fits in with the continuation with the first two Superman movies with good ol Chris. I was glad to have seen this movie, which was way more of a satisfying sequel than Superman III (1983), and deserves it's place within the mythology.

Review Title: Great for long time fans and newbies alike
Review: Whether you grew up reading the comic books as a child, or have lived in a bubble your whole life and never even heard of superman, this is a film that is guaranteed to please. I went into this film expecting nothing out of the ordinary, and left the theta speechless.The special effects in this movie are amazing in the way that they are not shoved in your face, but more serve to immerse you in the world of Metropolis and Smallville, if only for 2 1/2 hours.Being already a big fan of Kevin spacey, I was quite amazed with his portrayal of Lex, and Brandon Routh proves that you don't need years of experience to put on a great show.Bryan Singer did amazing on X-Men and X2, too bad he had nothing to do with X3 (but thats another review) and once again has shown why he might just be the next Spielberg.There were just a few moments in the movie that seemed to be lacking in momentum, but all in all it is a thrilling ride for all.

Review Title: what a waste of time and money!

Review: This movie was everything I hoped it would be. I was so thrilled with the storyline, actors, everything. I know some are complaining about the reality of this or that, but it's fiction based on a comic book. Superman was everything he was supposed to be and Brandon Routh did a great job! It's very hard to live up to the standards of someone who's done it so well before you, but Routh stood up to Reeve's performance and made it his own. Although nobody will ever compare in my eyes to Gene Hackman, as Lex Luthor, Kevin Spacey did a fantastic job. Kate Bosworth was believable and enjoyable as Lois Lane as well. I highly think that if you enjoyed the original Superman & Superman II you will love this movie as well!

Review Title: What more could be said? A class act and the best superhero movie to date
Review: What more could Bryan Singer have done for this movie? From the moment I stepped into the theater and heard the opening theme song, I was hooked. This movie is beyond incredible, and is definitely a movie for those who are seeking motivation searching for finding themselves. The special effects, the acting, it was all just a big chain reaction from the start. I had very high expectations because of my love for Batman Begins, and they were definitely fulfilled. Brandon Routh has a bright future ahead of him! I'm not trying to bash X-Men because I've deeply enjoyed those three films, but this movie is the Tiger Woods/Roger Federer of superhero films. Also, film director Singer hopped on board for this project instead of doing X3, so what does that tell you? You know, I really do believe when people are going through tough times or just in life in general, that they can turn to things which can help them overcome, and this movie is one of those things. Although he's from another planet, Superman is exactly like one of us in that he loves others and is passionate and caring. But most important, he's our idea of Superman, a complete bad ass! A bunch of humor and comedy in this movie as well. Kevin Spacey, who else could've done it better? I've just been very disappointed with so many people trying to bash this film saying how it's way too long and etc. I also think of what Lance Armstrong said to his critics when he won his 7th Tour De France, "I'm sorry you all don't believe in hope and miracles." This movie is certainly one of great faith and hope. Most of all, it's action packed and amazing! Superman has definitely returned thanks to Bryan Singer and the rest of the gang.

Review Title: 1978 Superman far superior to this mediocre version
Review: Obviously the affects are better and keeping the original soundtrack was a true blessing that saved the movie from being a complete lackluster.Bryan Singer avoided quite a few of the clichés of the first Richard Donner Superman...but his avoiding of the created a drone-like performance.Missing was the colorful Perry White, played by a going-thru-the motions Frank Langella...Who ever thought of casting Kate Bosworth...who by the way is FREASKISHLY too thin.Spacey's performance was uninspired and he was severely underused.Parker Posey as is half witted partner in crime was just completely miscast...she just was not right for the role.Just bad...what helped this movie was that it tried to keep a lot of elements of the original 1978 movie...otherwise this film could not possibly stand on it's own.Save your money...wait for the DVD and hope the sequel is not as bad.

Before i begin, i would like to state; i am a huge Superman fan.When i first heard of a new superman film in 1996 i was pumped. I had doubts about Nicolas Cage as Superman, but i was going to give him the chance to prove himself.Now over the past 10 years i have watched and listened to all the various reports, from Tim Burton to McG. When i heard what McG had planned i was expecting a disaster, then flew in Bryan Singer to save the day.I've thought his films were great from The Usual Suspects to X2. Now as a dedicated viewer of Smallville i had hoped that the series would go theatrical when it ended, continuing the great storyline of Lex and Clark knowing each other, but with Bryan Singer at the helm i had no worries.Now after seeing Superman Returns you will believe a man can fly, Superman did things in the film that only the comics and Superman: The Animated series have done. The plane rescue was jaw dropping. Now i have read and agree with some complaints about the plot and Kate Bosworth's performance. My hope for the inveitable sequel is that they amp up the action, possibly bring in characters from the comics that haven't been done on the big screen; such as Metallo or even Darkseid.With the upcoming release of the Richard Donner version of Superman II i know this year will be great for fans of Kal-El

I have to admit, I was pleasantly surprised by Brandon Routh. After hearing he came way of a soap opera, I was skeptical. But in every way he came through, sometimes hauntingly like the late Christopher Reeve. Bryan Singer continues his brilliant work behind the camera. Kevin Spacey had to fill the shoes Gene Hackman as the evil Lex Luthor, and while he didn't do it quite as well as good old Gene (who I would have LOVED to see reprise his roll here), Spacey was very good. The jury is still on Kate Bosworth for me, but she was a definite improvement on Margot Kidder's IRRITATING Lois Lane. Nice use of Marlon Brando's extra footage from almost 30 years ago.I would give this a 8.5 out of 10 (had to round up for the scale here). Definitely go check this out. Superman is back, baby!

Review Title: Cool effects, but I expect a Superman fight or something
Review: I made an observation. I'm a huge fan of comic book heroes and heroes' movies. And I conclude that when Brian Singer abandon Xmen 3, Xmen 3 was better in action, effects, and plot and Superman is the same thing in plot that the old movies. I know that Superman is a sequel, but when I refer to the same thing of the old movies I say the same boring battle between Superman and Luthor. We are in 2006; the only action and cool effect that I saw in Superman Returns movie was the scene about the airplane crash. When Superman Return was announce I imagine a great battle between Superman and another villain or Luther in a robot suit or artificial science powers. But NO, it was the same fixation, in fact I thing that the Smallville series is cooler that the movie, because you can see more villain and fantasies. The act of the actors was excellent and the effect too, but the plot it was too much and lame (that's my opinion). When you see Spiderman or Batman or Daredevil or XMen's movies you know what I'm talking about. When Superman Return was announce I imagine a battle in the air like Neo and Smith in the Matrix 3. But no, the plot was let's build an island in the middle of the ocean because I want power JAJAJAJA and that's that.

Let me confess right off that I am not a Superman fan. I'm honestly more of a Batman gal myself :D Anyway, because I hadn't seen any of the previous movies I was left a bit lost. I spent most of the film trying to figure out how the good people of Metropolis couldn't figure out the Superman/Clark Kent connection. The other half of the movie was spent staring at Kate Bosworth's enormous forehead. The acting isn't bad. I was amused by both Posey and Spacey, but annoyed by Routh's Superman. As Clark Kent he adorable, as Superman he's a bit of a jerk who says stupid lines and looks smug the whole time. The twists are fairly obvious, even to me---who hasn't seen or read anything about Superman. It wasn't a bad way to spend a hot afternoon, but I won't be re-watching it again or looking forward to the inevitable sequel.

Review Title: It's no fun at all.  A BIG let down.
Review: Where to begin? The movie blows. How's that for starters? Dull and wooden.The dialogue was boring. Kal-el and Lois Lane were lifeless and weak. Bryan Singer, the director, claimed that he was making a "chick flick" out of this Superman movie. He missed the mark by a mile. Stalking an ex- and eavesdropping on conversations is romantic? Being brooding and distant is romantic? Not talking is romantic? Hardly. A good romance movie has a more complicated emotional structure. This was rather simple and immature.Parker Posey was miscast. Instead of Ms. Teschmacher part II, she should have been cast as Lois Lane. She had much more screen presence than the waify Kate Bosworth. Lois Lane is a very strong female and Kate was just wispy and weak. The sad thing is that Bosworth's Lane is a good reflection of the weak and ineffectual state of current mainstream news media. God, it almost makes me mad about how lame the character is presented in Returns.The plot is pretty much exactly the same as Superman (1978). Even the Lex Luthor landgrab sceme is essentially the same. The opening credits and theme suggest that it's going to be the same style of movie but it isn't. Sadly, Returns is nowhere near as interesting as the original movie that "inspired" it.It depresses me that I'm giving this film a lousey review. I really did want to like it because I loved the original movies. Margot Kidder as Lois Lane was awesome. Those movies were fun. Returns takes itself way too seriously and it's no fun at all. In fact, I can't even bother looking for the rumored humorous gay subtext that people were talking about before the movie's release. It's just dull.

Review Title: He Has Returned and the torch passed burns bright!
Review: The Man of Steel has returned. And while the film is not perfect, as one critic put it, I felt like I was watching something epic, something that may not be fully appreciated for years down the line.A lot of people will sadly never accept changes to this character. They have a locked in view of what THEY think Superman should be. But Superman has been constantly re-envisioned over his lifetime. Imagine only one actor or performance of Hamlet. Tragedy. Bryan Singer has taken the mythology and brought it to a modern setting. Jimmy Olsen can have a beer. The Daily Planet can have computers. Some changes are more drastic, particularly a well-known spoiler about Lois and her son. But if you give the film the chance it deserves, this development could make The Man of Steel even more dynamic than before.Don't get me wrong- the film has its problems. The editing leaves the pace lagging at points and certain early scenes feel slightly out of place. But for the most part, the problems are small.Imagine being thrown into jail for 5 years. You devote your entire life to figuring out revenge- aside from the fact is you're already a little unhinged. Meet Lex Luthor 2.0. Kevin Spacey has that Hackman goofiness in Luthor, but effectively insane. Five years of waiting and fool-proofing and he is like a kid on Christmas when he finally beats Supes. There is a darker, more violent side to him that is terrifying to watch. You feel every punch and wince at every kick he lands.I wasn't initially sold on Kate Bosworth as Lois, and while she does look pretty young to have her own child, you can look past it if you allow yourself to get sucked back into the beloved Metropolis world. It was fun to see Lois actually investigate a case (rather than just see Lois sneak into a terrorist stronghold guarded by one dumb French guard) and her interaction with her son Jason is completely believable.Most importantly though...Brandon Routh. The Superman for our generation. He has the look. He has the voice. And despite what a lot of hack critics are saying, he doesn't try to do a carbon copy of Christopher Reeve. Superman needs to behave a certain way, speak a certain way, act a certain way. And Routh has it down. In particular, a moment of quiet reverence at night in a bedroom at the film's conclusion nailed down Routh's rightful place as Superman.The rest of the key performers all turned in admirable performances. Frank Langella made Perry White a different kind of editor (rather than the barking Perry White clone from Spider-man, Jameson), a softer but still driven newsman who knows how to rally the troops. James Marsden has become the go-to man for Hollywood in roles where he can't seem to completely win the girl- his Jason White is heroic and charming and you actually can see why Lois would be with him. Sam Huntington is the nerdy/cool Jimmy Olsen that fan boys have wanted to see for a while and delivers a lot of the film's best humor.As for Lois's kid...he's perfect. Innocent, cute (but not sappy), who reacts as any child would in these sorts of situations. He even delivers some really heart-wrenching moments.The special effects were superb and flight has never looked so good. I have no complaints- not one. Everything looked real. The superpowers are all there- flight, strength, speed, heat vision, freezing breath...sorry, no mind-wiping kiss or any of that though.The only performances I felt were wasted were Luthor's squad, but then, they are just muscle and sass- Lex Luthor doesn't work alone like Bat villains or Spidey villains. He's not a rogue. He has others help do his dirty work. So silent, but necessary.To set the record straight- I spoke with Bryan Singer at a speech on Christopher Reeve at Princeton last November. The man loves Superman. But this anti-American argument that I've read about. Garbage. BS. Singer told a small group of the reporters that Superman is a symbol that the entire WORLD recognizes. And it's true. Bryan told us he knew people were going to think he was going to try to make some sort of political statement. Just because "The American Way" is excluded from Perry White's speech after Superman returns does NOT mean that Singer is putting a jibe at the state of US affairs. He told us that this was to recognize Superman stands for truth and justice EVERYWHERE and the ideals of the world. He isn't just saving US lives.Some people have issue with Superman suddenly flying away. Logic aside (considering he went through worm holes and all kinds of sci-fi travel that can't be calculated in a realistic sense), put yourself in Superman's boots. You miss your parents. If that there is a chance your home world (and parents) may still be around and. wouldn't't't't you want to check?.Any child who has ever wondered about their real parents probably go through this. Bryan Singer would know- he was adopted too.The one big spoiler everyone is talking about? It works. It has a few flaws itself (which will likely be worked out in a sequel) but is effective. This is a side of Superman we've never seen before. And any fears of a smaller version of Superman flying around with him need to trust in the writers and the faithful director in that they hate that concept. But to see Superman in his new role, to see him recite Brando's speech about how he will be thought odd but never alone...that clinches it. Routh clinches it. The series is in good hands.

It was like being six again! I wanted to run home and wrap a towel around my neck, and fly through the house! I got to share this experience with my 8 yr old daughter, and she loved it! Superman is the original Super Hero! The way Brian Singer stuck to the Donner formula was top notch! Critics said this movie was too long, well it had a lot to say, and the time flew by! This movie has been set-up perfectly for a sequel, and I can't wait! Thank you Brian Singer for making me feel like a kid again! With the way the credits rolled, and John Williams score, it sent chills down my spine! I couldn't help myself but to say INCREDIBLE at the end of the amazing picture!

I figured this movie would be like other superhero movies such as Hulk and Daredevil and basically just be around for publicity. But I was wrong about Superman Returns. It's one of the best movies I've seen all year. Probably ever. I'm not one of those types who knows all about Superman, in fact, I have never seen any of the older movies but I still found this one to be approachable. I understood it quite well and from the first 10 minutes or so got the gist at what the storyline was. There were many twists in the movie that some say are very predictable but I honestly didn't see them coming. I won't give anything but I really hope they take the story even further with a sequel. If done correctly, I'm sure it would be awesome.

This movie was just horrible. It's unbelievable that Brian Singer directed such a bad movie. Xmen 2 was directed by him and that was an amazing movie. House, an amazing show is directed by him. This movie does look great yes. The acting is great, the scenery and special effects are great, but the movie lacks one key ingredient all movies need, a good plot. The plot was the abyss of this movie. It dragged out forever until the very end, then something finally happened. It was all just him going around saving people from random stuff. It wasn't really laced together at all. This movie was Brian Singers downfall. He better reclaim his glory with the sequel.

So far there hasn't really been a movie that stood out as a great summer movie. Until the Man of Steel returned from his 19 year absence from the silver screen. After the reinvention of the Batman series last summer I couldn't wait to see what Singer's offering of this legend would be. I won't spoil the plot for all those who haven't had the chance to see it yet but to say that it's storytelling on a grand scale much like the original movie. Singer's style for the Return of Superman is a familiar look between what he did with the xmen franchise and what Donner did with the first film. And Brandon Routh was a great choice as his performance seems to have captured the spirit of what Christopher Reeves did with the role in the 70's and 80's. To close I'd like to say it's the best time I've had at the movies so far this year and ranks with the likes of Spider-man 2 and Batman Begins. Great film-making!

This is easily one of my favorite movies. I was stunned once again by director Bryan Singer's Directing capacities. There are some amazing moments that I will NEVER forget. The guys at DC are amazing as you can obviously tell by how amazing the movie is. Michael Dougherty and Dan Harris never cease to surprise me with their talent. There is an obvious sense of humor which helps hold the movie up as they did in Batman Begins. The Acting is priceless. Kevin Spacey (Surprisingly) makes for an AMAZING Lex Luthor. Kate Bosworth is a great Lois Lane. Brandon Routh...Did his best? Kitty Kowalski did INCREDIBLE. She could easily win one an award for acting dumb. The special FX are quite incredible. With a large quantity of CGI and Greenscreen, It seems to come together very well. I was about a milimeter away from crying...I don't cry Easily.The Critics weren't too hot on it. But the movie was amazing anywayGo and see for yourself. You'll see what I'm talking about.

Considering the crap that Hollywood puts out. This is sure to revive your faith in a small group of filmmakers that seem to know what we need out here. The script was well done. Unlike "ebert" I thought the chemistry worked well between the characters. They did a great job of incorporating original score and script that kind of leaves you with a sense of memorializing to C. Reeve. The story does take a huge turn that you wouldn't expect and leaves you wanting to either hate the writers or love them depending how it will pan out. Of course though, it turns out well, and leaves plenty of room to be expanded upon. The effects were great. I dug the original font layouts in the beginning titles. Nice touch. All throughout, I think great care was taken to keep this thing legit. Although it isn't like the comics exactly, it is still a great movie. It does provide options and insight into Superman's inner world of himself a bit. This film will do very well despite what the critics are saying. They obviously are not in tune with the American public and don't rely on it. The only superman fans that wont like this film are the geeks that live their lives inside fictional characters 23 out of 24 hours of the day. I'm confident they will find something to whine about. Nonetheless, a very good job all around.

I enjoyed the movie very much. The opening titles.... WOW! Very nice. I left feeling as if I had seen a great movie.Tonight, I watched the original "Superman" on Cinemax... this movie very much follows suit in every way, but the visuals are such more better. (Amazing what 28 years of technology can do, huh?) Rather than the 2 sequels that followed the original movie, if you are watching them, I would probably want to see this one right after the original.This is not about the script or performances (and totally nit-picky) but I just wondered how the ages matched with the original actors at the time the original movie was made. Itwas interesting to learn that both actors portraying Superman were very close in age. Christopher Reeves was only a matter of months younger than Brandon Routh when each filmed his "Superman" movie. However, the 2 actresses portraying Lois Lane were not so close. Margot Kidder was 30 when she played Lois. Kate Bosworth was 23. So, during the 5 year absence of Superman (hope that is not a spoiler), he gained a few months (which I would expect slow aging for him as a Kryptonian), but Lois actually lost 7 years.. making her 12 years younger than she would have been if were were in real time. I know.. totally didn't matter to me... just couldn't help but look it up.I really really enjoyed this movie and would highly recommend it!

Review Title: Too much X-Men scenery...too little heart
Review: Bryan Singer, get off the X-Men kick dude! What a shame that Christopher Reeve's memory wasn't honoured in a better fashion. Take one of the greatest superhero movies ever made (Superman The Movie, 1978) and turn it into a lengthy film noir with a few decent special effects (VERY few) and lots of empty time spent staring at digitized artsy vistas of crystal shards. This wasn't supposed to be a rip off of the Spiderman "constantly searching my soul for who I am schtick", it should have been a feel good movie that made us care about the characters and loses us in childhood charms and imagination. Instead it took a very adult turn about redemption for past hurts, the agony of choosing between our heart and head, etc. etc. Just not a very good effort. On the positive side, the new guy playing Superman did an admirable job replacing a Hollywood legend in Christopher Reeve and with a better script and directing would be a lot of fun to watch.
