I was really jazzed about seeing this movie. After several attempts in the past ten years to bring Superman back to the big screen, finally, we had a movie! So, with the afternoon off from work, and a latté in hand, I was ready to welcome back 'the man of steel'. A quarter of the way through, despite the action and special effects, I was unmoved. Determined to have fun, I lowered my expectations. But half way through, my mind started to continually wondered off ("hmmm, I wonder if they still use canola oil for popcorn? hey, I wonder if shut off the coffee-maker?"). Three quarters of the way through, I started to check my watch every few minutes. This wasn't what I signed up for. There I sat in the dark theater eagerly anticipating a return to childhood wonderment, and instead this curiously unengaging film almost became my Ambien. In the days since I saw this movie, I wondered about my reaction to the movie. I mean, all the ingredients were there: good storyline, snappy dialog, plenty of action sequences, great special effects. And yet, there I sat, yawning. Then, it hit me (actually, my wife noticed it): Superman, remember he's the main character, had very little dialog, and expressed little emotion throughout the movie. Most of the snappy dialog was everybody else's but his. This is a major flaw. How did I miss it?! It's hard to care about the movie, if the movie's main character is un-engaging, or downright boring. That's what it boiled down to for me. Superman was boring, therefore the movie was boring. Period. Oh, and the drab washed out film colors did not help hold my attention either.Pass on this until it hits the dollar movies.

Review Title: a film done well sticking to the original rules of it's prequels.
Review: The cast of brilliant actors was selected perfectly, and i am so glad that Superman Returns did not go the way of Batman & Robin. Lets face it, it is a sequel - not a remake, so don't expect anything overly "new". As we all know having a new actor can ruin a series but if u liked the 4 previous superman movies starring Christopher Reeves the you will love Brandon Routh's portrayal of the man of steel. There are very few great movies where the sequels get better without taking away from the original (e.g. The Lord of the Rings), and luckily Superman Returns is one of those that i will be glad to have along side the other 4 superman movies in my DVD collection. ...i'm so dying to get the box set of all 5 when it comes out!

Review Title: We're back and we've got something to say...
Ignore the Haters - This Movie Rules
Review: There are all sorts of different reasons the haters are trashing this movie. A lot of them decided they were going to diss this movie even before they saw it. Funny they still rushed to the theatre to see it anyway. One reason they are being particularly vicious may have to do with the fact it had a significantly bigger opening weekend than the craptacular "Batman Begins". Well the only reason that movie was praised was because the horrid wretched stink of "Batman and Robin" was still fresh in everyone's psyche. Any new rethink of the Batman character after that atrocity was bound to do well and had people overlooking its many flaws the prebuscent looking completely miscast Katie Holmes for example. Now mind you the amount of time between when "Batman and Robin" came out and "Batman Begins" was only 8 years. The last time there was a Superman movie was 20 years ago! Another reason for all the negativity has to do with this trend of comparing this movie too closely to the 1978 original Superman. Let's not forget that movie started it all and set the bar for all super hero movies that followed. There was no way Bryan Singer would or could ignore that fact so he carefully remained faithful to what was created and started almost 30 years ago. The last and most obvious reason is homophobia and anti-semitism. Singer has been open about both his Jewish heritage as well as homosexuality and it was hard enough for a lot of prejudice haters to deal with the success he had with X-Men, but when he got to direct "Superman", that was just too much for them to swallow. They were determined to bash Singer and this movie no matter how good it really was. The bottom line is this movie should not and cannot compared to the original 1978 Superman even though it pays homage to it. At the same time this movie is far better than "Batman Begins" and "Spider-man 2" combined, but the haters won't admit it. They want you to think otherwise. This movie has many brilliantly executed action sequences, the right amount of comic relief while still having an edge, and a competent cast of actors including Routh who while isn't on the same level of Christopher Reeve, still does a fine job of playing The Man of Steel. All in all a fun and action packed and must see movie of the summer and especially if you can catch in IMax 3D.

Review Title: Everything about Superman Returns was great except the story
Review: Everything about Superman Returns was great except the story. I felt there was too many holes in the story, and felt like a rehash of the first story, but not as good. I think Superman the movie is still the best Superman movie with Superman Returns in 2nd place. I would have choose Superman 2 as the 2nd best, but effects were pretty cheesy, even for back then, but I liked the Superman 2 story much better. All in all, if you're not a fan of Superman, I would wait for it to come to DVD. Sorry Bryan Singer, I really wanted to love this movie, but I just didn't. I still love Singer's other movies and think he is a great director.

It appears that Bryan Singer has worked his movie magic yet again, but this time on a completely astonishing approach. he left the X-Men saga to direct a masterpiece on one of the greatest super-heroes of our time, Super-Man.The beginning left me alittle unsure, but towards the end of the beginning, i could tell this movie would surely top it all. Brandon Routh tosses us a curve-ball with glorious acting skills and amazing portrayal of the Man of Steel.Kevin Spacey shows us a dark, fiendish Lex Luthor, out to get revenge on Super-Man. and by the gods, he does magnificently. He makes us fear a true super-villain, unlike the works of films like Spider-Man and HULK. This, in my humble opinion, is the greatest super-hero movie ever. heck, ever my MOM cried during the film. i was touched by this masterpiece, as should others by this latest installment to the Bryan Singer saga of films. I hope that this film will one day make the top 250, and that you will all realize even the most unlikely of films can move more people than Harold & Maude(lol)

Review Title: Superman's return lacks its own identity as a film
250 million can't buy a good story...
superman returns soars to new heights
Review: superman returns blew me away. with the disappointing 4th superman being the last in the series for the past 18 years and the fifth superman film in developmental hell for the past 10 years there was a lot of hype for this film. did it deliver? HELL YES!!!! from marlon brandos legendary voice and john williams original superman theme at the opening to the film you are sucked right back in. singer made sure to keep the fans of the original film in mind as well as people who are coming into the superman universe for the 1st time. brandon routh amazingly fills some big shoes and kevin spacey brilliantly plays a much more evil lex luthor. the supporting cast all delivers. kate bosworth isn't exactly the ideal lois lane but she still does a good job. everything from the clever story, to the breath taking action, to the eye popping special effects is done to perfection. most importantly you will believe that a man can fly again. this is a great film that is a must see. its worth it

Review Title: The Best One Since the First Superman
Review: The only downfall to this movie is that it does not delve as deeply as a true Superman fan would like into the human relationships inherent in the Superman series. Superman/Clark barely exchanges with Jimmy or Perry White or even Lex for that matter. But I think there will be more of that in later movies. Other than that the movie is excellent. I love the classics, but the development of CGI allows the filmmaker to do so much more with Superman. And in case anyone didn't notice, it's wide open for sequels, which is great. For anyone complaining about the filmmaker not giving enough background information... IT'S SUPERMAN! For pete's sake... everyone knows the story of Superman. If you're not familiar enough for this movie to satisfy your craving for a quality Superman installment, then you shouldn't be watching it in the first place. Oh, and for the clown complaining about it not being fresh and original like Batman Begins... compare the titles RETURNS/BEGINS then look up the meanings. By the title, the director never promised a fresh start, it was a continuation. And because there will be sequels, there will be fresh starts and new angles. Long story short, the Batman series had been played out since the second movie and it needed a whole new start, but Superman did not. The world only needed to be reaquainted and the best way to do that is to simply continue on as the title suggests. And get off Bryan Singer's back, he's an action director. AAAAARGH. Pull your heads out of your asses. The audience responded extremely well at the viewing i attended, better than I've seen in a long time. This was a good movie, damn the critics. And using the original scores was a good idea, no one complained about the same Star Wars music over and over.

Review Title: Very good movie, but with a few flaws..

Review: Finally got to see more whoop ass and a little more darkness. SR also payed some homage to Superman: The movie. What else can I say is that since it lives up to the Chrsitopher reeve sequel it was a welcome site. had it been remade it would not have gotten such credibility. I saw Batman Begins and knew where this was going as Superman Returns was going to top it off as well as Spidy also. The special effects were fantastic and tied in from Smallville. Batman's got a cool car and everything, but is a regular joe who learned acrobats and hid behind a suit and swore on revenge to fight crime in the streets of Gotham City. Superman Returns is in favore.

Just returned from seeing "Superman Returns". I thought the casting was overall quite good. Of course, Kevin Spacey is a winner in almost every role. Brandon Routh should be cast in "The Christopher Reed Story" if it is ever filmed. He portrayed "The Man of Steel" uncannily like Mr. Reed. I gave this film a seven (7) because its weakest point is the plot. The story just never really grabs you and make you wait breathlessly for the next bit to unfold. The special effects were top notch, and the musical score was thrilling and entertaining throughout, but my companion at the film said he was bored the last hour and a half because the story just never went anywhere. Am I alone with this criticism? Maybe a bit of fine-tuning by the director and the editor might have brought a more compelling conclusion to the film. I will wait till it comes out with a "Director's Cut" DVD to see it again. Maybe the commentary will include what motivated the director to go the way he did. I have the feeling they were leaving the way clear for a sequel if this movie was successful at the box office. I loved the detail work and effort for realism that was maintained, and only wish the writer had worked out his story a little more. Spacey must have loved portraying Lex Luthor! Following in the hallowed footsteps of Gene Hackman's portrayal, I believe he did a first rate job. I would certainly encourage the recasting of Mr. Spacey and Mr. Routh in any future films carrying on the "Superman" dynasty.

Review Title: Potential to be Further Explored in the Sequels

Review: WAY too much back-story. If Fisher was trying to go for the angst of a love opportunity missed, he fell short of the mark. In doing so, he also fell short of the cool stuff too. When most of the good effects and scenes are in the trailer, the movie is in trouble.The "original" back in '78 with its now hokey effects and tongue in cheek humor (I hated Margo Kidder-Stockard Channing would have been better), was at least more cleverly written. Even though the bad guy (Lex) have a seemingly endless supply of Kryptonite, the plot involved a true challenge of Superman's abilities and conscience.This movie, with its short, simple plot and loose ends, point to a (hopefully) better sequel that I'm guessing was filmed simultaneously.

I must say I am very surprised at the number of movie goers who did not like (in my case, it was fantastic) the new Superman movie. I have been waiting for it to come out since the first trailer and tried hard not to get my hopes us (as remakes normally go), I was not familiar with some of the cast, however with Kevin Spacey in the mix, I was curious. I was instantly hooked, from the open credits till the end; I was eagerly awaiting the next scene throughout the movie and never found myself board. Kevin Spacey, Parker Posey, Kate Bosworth, and Brandon Routh gave you that familiar feeling of well known characters from the past while still owing it as themselves, not simply an imitation of the actors we know from the past. Sticking to the original score was a wonderful idea, it is synonymous with the "man of steel" and I smiled every time I heard it. Spacey and Routh on screen chemistry and timing was brilliant, I cannot wait until they do it again.

Review Title: Did they not learn ANYTHING from Spiderman's success?
Review: Part of Spiderman films success is due to the intense, hot, palpable sexual feelings that views can observe. Everyone needs the Superhero; the hero needs the heroine. Ohh the want, the unspoken hunger and lust. Spiderman conveyed more passion in a single kiss than Superman does in the entire film.Don't get me wrong -- I loved the film. I'm just saddened by knowing what it is not, what it could have been. Because it could have been better, it could have been great. Everyone who came wanting to see Superman trembling with passion and pent up emotion take Lois slowly, gently, into his arms and JUST KISS HER WITH THE WILD ABANDON that Clark never would or could please raise their hand. Counting 1, 2, 3...Hello?

Bryan Singer knows how to make movies. Period, end of story. A few years ago, when I heard that Brandon Routh had won the role of Clark Kent/Superman in the new Superman movie, I wasn't concerned. I liked that they were using an unknown and he looked like he'd fit the roles. I wasn't wrong. Routh is an excellent Clark Kent – confident on the farm, bumbling at the Daily Planet. And he makes an even better Superman. Routh brings depth to both characters and you can read his emotions on his face. He has the most beautiful face I've seen on screen.I think this movie is everything a comic book flick should be. It's got action, humor, feelings, a love triangle, and inside stuff to warm my geek heart. I love that there are cameos by two stars from the 1950's TV series, Superman. I love the inside jokes and quotes from Superman lore. I love the new Superman outfit. I should point out that I'm female and I've seen the film four times already.I felt that Kevin Spacey's Lex Luthor was probably the most evil film villain I've seen yet. What he did was just so unthinkably awful, I felt sorry for poor Superman having to clean all the mess up. Luthor's henchmen were all great, and Parker Posey as Kitty was a hoot and a half.Kate Bosworth is an okay Lois Lane. Lois Lane has never been one of my favorite characters anyway. I hate how she loves Superman and not Clark Kent. My allegiance has always been to CK (although don't get me wrong, I'd take Supes in a heartbeat as well). I just like the man behind the tights, that's all. But Bosworth is a tad young for this role – she's only 23 and has a five-year-old child. I don't know how old the Lois character is supposed to be, but Bosworth does look her age so it doesn't help matters. However, she is a good actress and does a decent enough job. I just don't get how she can be tossed around so much in the movie and not have one single bruise (oh yeah, it's a comic movie).I didn't have a problem with Jimmy Olson or Perry White – they just were kind of bland to me. I felt the other hero of the film is James Marsden's Richard White. He was excellent in the movie and deserves credit for its success. I wish I had things so bad to be torn between two such hot, upstanding men. Do they exist in real life, I mean really?? Sure, some of the stuff could've been cut from the film to tighten it up a bit, but overall it's a great film in my opinion. I think the opening credits are worth the price of admission. I felt 15 again, as if I were watching Superman The Movie (which I saw in January 1979)! I can't wait for the DVD with all the extras and I hope deleted scenes. My one and only gripe about the film is why does Clark/Superman's eye color keep changing from blue to brown? It makes no sense why in some scenes Supes has blue eyes, and in another scene they are brown. Is this done on purpose and, if so, why? But hey if that's the biggest problem I can find with the film, I'm sure the filmmakers are happy.

Review Title: Very good considering it isn't reeve
Review: As with the first person to comment on this film i too went with some bias in mind. however i enjoyed all the previous superman films, no they weren't exactly the best acted but they were all enjoyable and fun.I watched this film whilst on holiday in Florida a few days ago and i really enjoyed it. I felt the likeness between Reeve and Routh was frightening!! And the first 10 minutes of the film my jaw was on the floor.I don't want to ruin the film for anyone reading this so i wont write too much but i will say that everyone should go and watch this, young and old. There is a big twist but it is quite obvious early on (well to me it was anyway) but don't let this put you off as the acting is good enough to be a blockbuster and no it doesn't warrant an Oscar for the acting but its a lot better than a lot of other films out at the moment.Go and watch it.

Anyone assuming that you'll be seeing a restart of the Superman series on par with the excellent "Batman Begins" movie will be sorely disappointed. Be prepared for a rather large lack of back story, character development, or likable characters.Only until after watching the movie did someone explain that this film is allegedly set chronologically somewhere between Superman 2 and 3 or after Superman 3 and to ignore Superman 4, 5, Smallville, Lois and Clark, and most of the comic book series. How are we supposed to know this? Um, dumb luck, word of mouth, fan sites... The director certainly didn't help you there.Lex Luthor is portrayed as just evil. He was funny/evil in previous movies, but here, he's just bad. Lois still can't spell to save her life, but emotions aren't in her acting vocabulary. Jimmy's barely on the screen. The Christopher Reeves stand-in they got is dead on for looks and on par with Mr. Reeves's current acting ability. This is most likely to the most dull of scripts designed for Superman so far.Sure, you've got your Technicolor Spandex adventures, but while trying not to nod off, all I could think is that Batman could totally whup this "super man" in a fight, and he's supposed to be the greatest of the great. If Superman is the one to inspire humanity to a higher standard, I want a rewrite.

Review Title: Good, but long on time, short on plot
Superman Returns as Box Office Hit!~
Review: I haven't looked forward to many movies for the past few years. Even Superman Returns seemed to be a movie too huge for anyone to make and satisfy hardcore fans and be appealing to those who do not know Superman's stories. But Superman Returns did just that. It delivered in staying true to the classic image of Superman, while portraying Superman in a today's modern world. The movie captured a blend of Superman's stories and still easily told the tale to anyone who didn't know Superman's stories. Superman Returns truly brought back a classic American icon into the mainstream. "Superman Returns," I'd say is a rival for all blockbuster movies such as the Spiderman and the amazing Star Wars series. Of course, Superman Returns needs high praised sequels to actually be considered a great movie series, but if Superman's next movies get higher and higher ratings, Superman will become even greater than just being SUPER!~

When I heard that there was going to be a new Superman Movie, I was not sure what to think if it was going to be good. But with Batman Begins, I said that maybe a it could work in the new era, with the technology that we have today, than over 27 years ago with first Superman movie this could work. After viewing the movie, I came to realize that you need more that computer special effects to help you. THIS MOVIE WAS HORRIBLE. If was not entertaining, you could get more excitement from watching Superman on Jutice League or Smallville. In the first hour and thirty minutes all he did was stop a plane from crashing. The rest of the time he is try to get back in good with Ms. Lois Lane who, moved on the new man in her life. After that is them trying to profess their love but could not do it. The movie should have been called Forbidding Love... The Superman, Lois Lane Story. The director and screenwriter where try to make another Siderman movie , when in my opinion they should have tried the Batman Begins type plot. If you are looking for a love movie with your boyfriend or girlfriend this is the one to see. I hope that they don't make a sequel and that superman having a KID with Lois Lane bad idea. If you are a true Superman fan you will agree with me with how bad this movie was from script to the lack of action sequences. I should have went and see the DEVIL WEARS PARDA, it looks more manly movie to me.

Review Title: Very good non-epic can't hit it out of the park
Review: Finally a new Superman movie appears in "Superman Returns," and while it is a good film, what it really does the most is remind everyone just how incredible "Superman The Movie" is, and how perfect Chris Reeve is at playing Superman.Superman comes back after five years (ignoring Superman 3 and 4) and starts his do-gooding all over again, while striving to make up with lois Lane, who he ditched without saying goodbye. The five-years thing is kind of easy to buy, even though the movie shows the piece of Kryptonite (from Adas Abbaba or however it is spelled) that came to Earth in 1978, and actually pointing out it came in 1978, in one of the many nods to the first film.Superman starts off again in the now famous plane-saving sequence - but I'm wondering, am I the only one that was underwhelmed at this scene? From what i've read and heard about it, I almost expected the most amazing scene ever put on film - but instead, it was just a typical CGI-cartoon scene of a cartoon Superman saving a cartoon plane. The scene on the ground after the plane was settled down on the ballfield was actually much better.But that kind of tells the story of the movie - Superman cries for an "epic" but "Superman Returns" just isn't an epic. The special effects are really just typical CGI cartoons and nothing special, really the FX in "Superman" from 1978, made almost 30 years earlier, are much better and much more realistic.The most fun about Superman Returns is spotting all the nods to "Superman The Movie," my favorites being Clark saying "swell" and the title sequence at the film's start. There are many little things scattered in the picture that maybe only real diehards would know.The acting - Brandon Routh was good, but it shows how hard it must have been to find someone to play Superman/Clark. He is OK, but not great. Not bad, he gets it done, but he doesn't light up the screen. He essentially is playing Chris Reeve as Superman and Chris Reeve as Clark Kent. There are a few moments as Clark where not only does he look and act like Reeve playing Clark, but he even sounds just like him. The fact is, Routh has competition impossible to beat - Reeve was the absolute perfect Superman/Clark. That's tough to even come to close to matching. Routh was definitely good, but when compared to Reeve, it's the best we're probably going to get.Lois Lane was OK, but Frank Langella as Perry White was horrible. Perry has turned into a soft, weak old man, nothing at all like the firebrand old-school newsman that Jackie Cooper's Perry was. Kevin Spacey was OK as Luthor, but again, like with Routh, it looks like Spacey was playing Gene Hackman playing Luthor all too often, and actually he comes across as less sincere than Routh does. He's still not bad, but I couldn't get past that all I was seeing was a Hackman imitator - Spacey didn't make Luthor his own at all. John Shea's Luthor in "Lois and Clark" blows away Spacey. At least Shea makes Luthor his own, and isn't a Hackman wanna-be clone.Actually the best acting in Superman Returns seems to have come from the guy who played Jimmy Olsen. I've only seen him in two things - this film, and the KISS film "Detroit Rock City" - and he was the best of the cast in both. In Superman Returns, he seemed the most convincing and the most sincere out of the entire cast.There are a lot of great elements in Superman Returns, especially using Marlon Brando, and the great final shot, the perfect nod to the first film. But the film, while good, just doesn't hit a home run. It is definitely a good movie, definitely entertaining and enjoyable, but there are a few things missing that keep it from being a true "epic." They say it cost over $250 million to make, but if anyone knows the history, it's obvious there isn't anything near that on screen and so much of that is what was spent over the past decade trying to get a Superman film off the ground. A reference to one of the original Superman titles for a new franchise, "Superman Lives," is easily visible for those who know the back story.I do hope there is a sequel, because what the franchise needs, is General Zod and company to return and wreak some major havoc.I read the original Superman The Movie grossed $380 million dollars in today's dollars. There's no way this one will even begin to touch that - but a decent sequel will be a big help to the franchise.And oh yeah - despite cowardly Hollywood liberalism, having changed Superman's key phrase, to any real fans of Superman, it will always be, "Truth, Justice, and the American way."

Review Title: Movie makes you want to evolve
Review: This is a film which is truly worthy of the original. Special effects, plot, casting, all fantastic. This movie has one of the best trailers I've ever seen. Anyone who has seen Xmen1 and Xmen 2 will agree that Bryan Singer does a great job of bringing the characters personalities to life, while adding some comic relief from time to time. The modern technology that the movie industry has at its disposal really aided in making the amazing stunts performed by Superman look real. I'm really glad that they kept the classical Superman music, this movie really wouldn't have been the same without it. Think of Star Wars movies without the Star Wars theme. All around I gave this movie a 9/10. Kudos to Brandon Routhe in coming up huge with this Superman role, he's going to be great.

Review Title: Why the audience need Superman Returns?
Enjoyed it 3 times, going back again...
Review: Someone mentioned spying on others; I have stood outside someone's house, just to feel close to them...wishing our relationship could have been different. I loved it! I absolutely loved this movie; it had heart, soul AND great action sequences... I crave those quiet moments in a movie when you are the one peeking in on a moment meant only for the participants. Being privy to private emotional moments makes a film for me.It also helps that Superman is, as always, a hunk! Brandon Routh breathed new life into the persona of Superman; his emotional nuances and expressive eyes said much more than any words. Sign me...holding my breath for the next installment.

This movie was very disappointing. While there was nothing really bad about it, there was nothing really good about it either. It was as if Bryan Singer plastered every cliché he could think of and then tried to fit them together. Sometimes doing this works. My Best Friend Is A Vampire and Beyond The Valley Of The Dolls have every cliché you can have yet they're still entertaining because they don't take themselves too seriously. They're also short so your quickly entertained and don't have time to think out the plot holes and the lack of originality. This has a bunch of filler that doesn't work like Louis Lane being married with a child and the whole thing just collapses under its own weight. I hate to say it, but this pales in comparison to Smallville and Smallville isn't even that great of a television show. If you want to want to watch Superman at its best then watch either Smallville or Superman II (Superman II in particular).

I had high hopes for the Man of Steel. I grew increasingly excited as the opening credits rolled. There was some fantastic talent in the film and I couldn't wait to see what they had achieved. Perhaps this anticipation, bottled up and overflowing from the disappointment of X-men 3, was the kiss of death for my viewing experience of Superman Returns.Very soon in the movie, all sorts of plot questions developed, but the movie was agonizingly slow to answer them or didn't really address them at all. The backstory regarding Superman's departure five years earlier is woefully undeveloped. I don't feel like we can truly appreciate the RETURN of Superman if we don't understand the details of his departure.The plot is overall dull and predictable. There is only one interesting plot twist, and its potential remains largely untapped. Lex Luthor's insidious plot for world domination seemed half-assed, poorly thought out, and downright childish.The action and special effects are generally good, but also plain and unimaginative. The only involving action sequence was the airplane disaster; from there, everything seemed underwhelming, mostly involving long, slow glamour shots intending to show-off Superman's might. However, the traditional Superman music score works well, and I couldn't imagine it any other way.The pacing and editing was frequently choppy. This is a bit alarming as I never noticed this before in a Singer movie. I found myself checking my watch frequently after the halfway point. Afterwards, I asked several friends separately what they thought of the movie; they each immediately answered, "It was a bit long." I don't mind a movie that pauses to develop its characters and plot, but many of the slow scenes in Superman seemed pointless or worse yet, superficial.The acting was okay, but I sensed no chemistry between ANYONE. Not between Superman and Lex Luthor. Not between Superman and Lois. All in all, in spite of the incessant attempts at development, much of the interaction seemed random and meaningless.In the end, it feels not like a memorable addition to the Superman saga, but rather like another unremarkable chapter. It wasn't a horrible movie, but it was a far cry from super. Maybe it should have been called Mediocre-Man Returns or Okay-Man Returns.

I felt an awkward phobia prior to entering the movie theater to see Superman Returns. I knew that Brandon Routh was essentially an "unknown" to mainstream American moviegoers and I knew this film was his true debut role (and what a great role it is). I left the theater literally blown away by the special effects and Mr. Routh's great portrayal of our wonderful comic superhero (of course it doesn't hurt that he is absolutely great looking too!).Parker Posey did a great job as Kitty and of course Kevin Spacey was a natural as Lex Luthor. Even though the critics seemed to come down hard on Kate Bosworth, I think she showed true on screen chemistry with Mr. Routh. If you haven't seen this movie you are missing out. I am going back to see it on the big screen at least once more...it is absolutely fabulous. Bryan Singer...wow what a director! And Brandon Routh is here to stay! You'll leave this movie feeling great and really believing a man can fly.Go see it now!

I was really please to see the man of steel on the BIG screen again. This was long overdue. The movie was a little long but the special effects made this movie one of the best visually. i know that Lex Luther is an limited super-villain because he doesn't have any super powers or abilities yet he held his own. I hope this will spin-off into at least two more movies so we can fall in love with the American hero all over again. the opportunities are endless for adventures. This movies does offer some new and exciting plot lines that should stem off into not only new movies but usher is into he next inception of the super man saga. i also home they will revisit the super-girl story and have the super cousins in a movie together.

Review Title: Droll, Unexciting, Boring, Predictable and Utterly Worthless Film
Review: I had gone to see Superman: Returns with the hopes that it would follow in the successes of other graphic novels brought to the big screen, but I was sorely mistaken. The film was unexciting and felt FAR longer than its' 2 hours and 45 minutes (or thereabouts). It was the only film that I have seriously considered listening to my iPod in or simply walking out. The only saving grace was that Kevin Spacey's character, Lex Luther, played a fair part and was marginally humorous. Not only was the film completely, SOUL-CRUSHINGLY, boring with that exception; cliché after cliché was presented as if no-one had ever seen an action film before. The plot is nearly completely worthless and is so predictable that this is not even worth the price of admission. Do yourself a favor: imagine a superhero movie with every cliché possible, and you've got Superman: Returns without spending the cash for a ticket.

The whole concept of the movie completely undermines what makes Superman such an iconic figure- the fact that he is nobly selfless and chooses to deny personal ambition in order to simply dutifully protect and serve mankind. No character with a normal amount of selflessness (and Superman's powers) would ever leave earth for 5 years, much less a character that is supposed to be the embodiment of a selfless protector. I am frankly very upset that this movie takes such license with the essence of the Superman mythology and hope that this doesn't undermine what Superman stands for for the next generation of Americans.

I'm so anxious to watch this movie as when the last time i've seen it i was still a little kid now i'm grown up and decided to give it a go.From what i can see the story is well.. not too bad. Now here is the real thing. The casts for the characters, for Lois lane, she looks old and for Clark he is simply too young. The villain lex, well he is great.The effects, it is real and so entertaining especially when the flying scene of the plane to the baseball field and i can't hardly see any wire attached to it.My advise, put more bad guys inside and more action, not much talking if possible. We are looking at a sci-fi movie not a drama.

Superman's back and I was as excited as anyone to see what was being called a triumphant return. Sorrily, I was disappointed. A superhero budget may have empowered this popcorn flick, but a lackluster script with a so-what conclusion destroyed it for me. The plot was utterly pointless, consisting mainly of shallow encounters and the sorriest excuse for an evil plot I have ever witnessed. Sure, Spacey gives the character of Lex Luther some depth; but it seems that he overacted the character a bit, taking an idiotic plot and fighting to make it seem perilous. I'm sorry, but Singer shouldn't have to constantly remind me that the Lex's plan will do some harm. I must give credit where it is due, though: Singer does a fantastic job of creating intriguing characters and spectacular action scenes. Superman was acted with real bravado by Brandon Routh and I felt that the complex Louis Lane character was genuinely presented by Kate Bosworth. If your looking for some bang for your buck, Superman offers the goods; just don't expect a deep storyline. Full of wham-bam thrills Superman will satisfy the thrill-junkie in all of us, I just didn't think that was enough for such a high profile movie. Make no mistake, this movie is not of the same caliber as the Spiderman or X-men movies of late, but go into the movie expecting only summer action and you won't be disappointed.

I watched this movie the Friday of the week it came out and I can tell You if you like superman 1 or 2 u need to watch this...its hard to Replace a Christopher Reeve but Routh gets it done.....the way Routh Talks sometimes makes you think its reeve.....and not only that he Favors reeve's looks a lot also.....not only Routh but Spacey gets it Done as Lex Luther.....as any person would know Luther is a crazy and Bizarre character and spacey pulls this off! The special effects are Greta if not one of the best special effects movies ever.....Yet I gave this a nine because of Kate Bosworth as Lois lane....shes Does a good job but not great.....If you haven't watched yet please go watch and see for yourself what a Superior job Bryan singer has done.....

Don't let the rants of a few dissuade you from seeing this excellent movie. I initially wasn't happy that they were planning this movie to be an extension of the originals, but I must say, I was SO happy after seeing this movie! My jaw was on the floor for most of the movie, as the Superman feats in the movie far surpass anything I've seen in other movies when it comes to pure entertainment and great special effects. Of course this movie's story was somewhat basic, as it was designed to setup a franchise (hopefully). And the way the movie ends, I can say that a sequel should be AMAZING! It's imho, the best superhero movie to date, very reminiscent of the Spiderman movies (but better).

I just got back from seeing this with my kids in IMAX 3d and we loved this film. It really was a relief for me because with the kind of violent films out these days this was something I didn't mind my kids seeing. The scenes between Lois Lane and Superman were tastefully and so respectfully done. It brought me back to the days of a gentleman showing how to treat a lady in great films of the past and was something I wanted my kids to see. I thought that was a particularly classy and endearing element of the film that makes it so unique and uplifting in these uncertain times. I can't understand how people could not like this film. I've never seen the original Superman of the 70s so maybe that's why. I viewed this movie at face value full well knowing this is after all based on an imaginary character but isn't that why we go to see these movies in the first place? It really is about escapism and spending 2 and a half hours in another world completely unlike our own. I certainly wasn't critiquing this film in my mind the same way I would let's say United 93. It didn't feel too long or drawn out to me or my kids at all. Then again maybe we weren't trying to dig too deep for something else other than a feel good fantasy film. In that sense this film passed the test with flying colors.

Review Title: This Superman Kicks Box Office Butt
Review: I don't know what people are talking about who say this movie isn't doing well enough at the box office. I work at an IMAX theatre where we get 200 and more calls an hour about getting advance tickets for Superman Returns and it has been like this for two weeks nonstop since the movie has opened. Shows are quickly sold out and we have people showing up in groves trying to get in to each sold out show. Now I don't know what it's like out in the real rural areas but I have never seen a response to any movie we have shown and I've been working at this IMax now for 3 and a half years. Maybe it's that people are flocking to see the movie in IMAX as opposed to the regular theatres and that's where attendance is lower. I have seen the movie twice in both a regular theatre and in IMAX and I have to say there is no comparison. The experience of seeing Superman in IMAX 3D is way better in my opinion and there is nothing like it. I imagine another kind of movie that would be equally exciting or better to see in IMAX3d would be maybe Jurassic Park.

The movie was intended to resemble the 1978 portrayal of Superman. In fact, it was supposed to be something of a modernized sequel to it. I would say the similarities in all the characters is a great thing. The action scenes are great, the emotional scenes are great, and there's humor thrown in the mix too. This was a great movie that makes up for the enormous failures that were Superman II, III, and IV. In the future, when people refer to Superman, this will be regarded as the real story.Also, it sets itself up nicely for a sequel...PH

Review Title: This comment focuses on the disappointment in Bryan Singer's vision of Superman Returns.

Review: First off I had my doubts going into the theater. John Williams changed that upon the start of the movie. The music was very reminiscent of Star Wars in that it grabbed the audiences' attention at the very beginning and then put you in the mood for the start of the movie.The story line is a bit different, watching the first Superman helps greatly in understanding a lot of the concepts that Singer implements in this movie. His ideas of who Superman is can be seen. Christopher Reeve played an amazing Superman, but his alter-ego Clark Kent can be seen by all as down right weird. I believe that Brandon Routh played a better Clark Kent. His idea of Clark Kent seemed like a mask that many kids use in High School. Routh had the right idea that Superman uses Clark to hide his identity instead of the Reeves idea which is to show an opposite of Superman. Both hide identities but Routh's Clark does a better job. He also did a good job of reviving Clark Kent's moral dilemma with Lois Lane.Lois Lane was played by Kate Bosworth who has this innocent appearance. Margot Kidder is probably the best selection that could be made in the older Superman movies but she came off a little too aggressive for my taste. I believe that Kate Bosworth has this kind of Audrey Hepburn like way in that she is innocent, beautiful, and everyone loves her. Bosworth played a very good Lois Lane in her own inner conflicts as well.Kevin Spacey played Lex Luthor. Spacey took the role of Luthor and morphed into his own idea. He keeps the true persona of Luthor which wants to make a mark in the history of the world and he also adds in some very funny euphemisms which add more to the character. I see Luthor a little different than Spacey or Singer sees him. I would have rather had an evil persona with no comedic relief, but Singer thought that should be added.The genius of Singer is that he used a lot of psychological conflicts in his characters. The audience can sit in the brain of the theater and see the inner struggles that the characters face. Singer stayed true to the original intent of Superman. Many Americans see Superman as a 'Christ like symbol', namely Jesus. Singer (Jewish) stayed true to Jerry Siegel and Joe Shuster's (both Jewish) idea of Superman. Singer kept the Messiah that the Jews hope for comparing him to a Moses like figure. Moses, who leads by example, took the Jews out of Egypt, through the Exodus (which is the central focal point of Judaism). Superman, as Jor-El states in the 1978 classic, "They can be a great people Kal-El. If they wish to be. They only lack the light to show the way." Superman is the light like Moses to lead the people to a promised land, a land where man can be great by following the light.I had my doubts about Superman Returns. Please go see the movie and judge for yourself. The only advice I can give is that if you enter the theater as a child you will leave with not only a smile but the thought that maybe you can fly.

Review Title: MUCH BETTER on the second viewing
Review: Must admit that I wasn't too impressed when I first saw Superman Returns, but decided that it had enough potential to warrant a second viewing - and I'm glad that I did give it a second go as I enjoyed it a LOT more than the first time.I'm one of those who is old enough to have seen the two Donner originals when they were first released and I guess that, try as I might, I couldn't help but expect that Superman Returns would be in the same vein. Well, it is and it isn't .......... can't say much more without giving out spoilers. :-)So, to all the naysayers here - give it another go and then see what you think, hopefully you'll have the same positive reaction as I did.

Review Title: A 2-and-a-half hour homage to the Donner classic. But there's nothing wrong with that
Review: Much of the criticism that surrounds "Superman Returns", director Bryan Singer's revival of the most treasured of superhero franchises, is that its story is highly derivative of the celebrated original. There's an element of truth in this notion: We again see Superman (Brandon Routh) crash land on earth – albeit this time after a 5-year layoff – and we again see an egomaniacal Lex Luthor (Kevin Spacey) who risks the same millions of innocent lives for the same financial gain to be had from a nefarious real estate scheme. It's indeed where the picture is at it's weakest. There are interesting plot points, however, that give us glimpses of the Superman franchise will go next – and this is a picture which will invariably be a huge success and spawn several more sequels. Lois Lane (Kate Bosworth) has a son, for instance, and with the introduction of her fiancée, Richard (James Marsden) – who has the worst luck in the world in having to compete with the Man of Steel for Lois – the most famous and strange love triangle in superhero tradition becomes an intriguing love square.But what does the actual story matter when the picture is awash with such glorious nostalgia? Almost twenty years since the last Superman picture was released on to the silver screen, the audience is less concerned with Luthor's plot than they are with reliving Gene Hackman in Kevin Spacey – he's less of a joke-cracker, we conclude, and more twisted and evil. Bosworth's Lois is less sass and more sex, and Brandon Routh (who shares a striking resemblance to the young Chris Reeve) plays Clark Kent as less of a stumbling, bumbling dork that Reeve portrayed so humorously, and more of a sweet, caring geek. And his Superman is true to the icon: integrity to the bone as he fights for "Truth, Justice and All That Stuff". Routh, even when given limited dialogue, can still capture that sense of infallibility that Christopher Reeve forever forged in our imaginations."Superman Returns" is a lengthy 2-and-a-half hours, but it's a 2-and-a-half hour homage to the Donner classic, and there's nothing wrong with that. From the intergalactic credits that propel you right back into the seat you occupied when you first saw Superman, accompanied by a John Ottman score that gives the classic John Williams themes plenty of use, Superman Returns is a picture filled with breathtaking action sequences, solid performances, and dialogue with just the right number of quotable lines borrowed unapologetically from the original. "You will be different", Superman memorably recites at the closing of the picture. Well, maybe Singer hasn't. Maybe Singer didn't need to. It doesn't matter to me either way, as "Superman Returns" is an exceptionally entertaining and enjoyable experience that serves just as well as an extension of; or a tribute to; the Superman mythology.

Yes...I've seen it and it was very emotive, to watch a great movie with all those clichés that make's one to remember Christopher Reeve's films..from the beginning with the overture (very similar with Richard Donner's) to the final scene with Superman flying in the outer space.. I've got to say that it is not a movie entirely for fans because they don't respect the hole comic book like Spiderman, X-Men or even the outstanding Batman Begins..but it keeps its essence...It's a very good story of Superman, returning to an Earth that have learned to live without him, with amazing special effects and incredible performances by Brandon Routh (he so looked like Reeve), Kate Bossworth and of course Kevin Spacey's Lex Luthor.. Superman is back for good, better than ever..

Review Title: A waste of my time and MONEY!!

Review: Superman Returns is a fun time for just about anyone. Being a big fan of the comic books and earlier movies, I found many problems with it but I didn't regret paying to see it.Kevin Spacey plays Lex Luthor very well, but if Hackman wasn't too old, I'd prefer him. The acting in this movie is overall mediocre. Reeves was a better Superman, flat out. There was plenty of comic relief using Jimmy Olsen and Clark Kent's clumsy work habits.I'd recommend seeing it, but only if you're willing to accept that it's not perfect. I noticed that almost every shot of Superman was zoomed into his nose. I suppose it's because from angles, he looks a great deal like Reeves did.

Review Title: In the name of the father, the son and the godfather!
